original_title: Sri Lanka’s Expolanka buys US-based customs broker for $42.5mn
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka Expolanka Holsings said it had bought a 100 percent stake in US –based Trans American Customhouse brokers LLC group of companies for 42.5 million US dollars.

“EFL Global LLC (EFL USA), a fully owned subsidiary of Expolanka Holdings PLC (Expolanka) has acquired 100% equity interest of Trans American Customhouse brokers LLC and its related companies (Trans American Group) on February 24, 2023, for a purchase consideration of 42.5 million US dollars,”the firm said in a stock exchange filing.
Trans American Group is a leading Customs House Broker in North America, that provides logistics services globally.
Colombo-listed Expolanka stock gained 2.8 percent to 180 rupees at close on Monday’s trading.
The firm recorded a profit of 2.9 billion rupees in the December 2022 quarter down from 23.04 billion dollars a year ago.

“The acquisition will enable EFL to extend its brokerage services to its existing customer base thereby enhancing service portfolio to existing customers, expand its customer base and scale its operations across North America” the firm said. (Colombo/ Feb 27/2023)
